member.name: T:FishUI.Controls.Control
member.summary: Base class for all FishUI controls. Provides common functionality for positioning, sizing, rendering, input handling, and parent-child relationships.
member.remarks: This partial class is split across multiple files: - Control.cs (this file): Core properties, fields, and events - Control.Animation.cs: Animation methods (FadeIn, SlideIn, etc.) - Control.Anchoring.cs: Anchor system for responsive layouts - Control.AutoSize.cs: Auto-sizing based on content - Control.Children.cs: Child control management - Control.Drawing.cs: Rendering and drawing methods - Control.Input.cs: Input event handlers - Control.Position.cs: Position and size calculations

member.name: P:FishUI.Controls.Control.Anchor
member.summary: Anchor settings for responsive resizing. Determines how this control repositions/resizes when the parent resizes. Default is TopLeft (fixed position relative to parent origin).

member.name: P:FishUI.Controls.Control.AnchorRight
member.summary: Stores the initial distance from the right edge of parent. Used for right anchor calculations. Set automatically when the control is added to a parent.

member.name: P:FishUI.Controls.Control.AnchorBottom
member.summary: Stores the initial distance from the bottom edge of parent. Used for bottom anchor calculations. Set automatically when the control is added to a parent.

member.name: P:FishUI.Controls.Control.AnchorParentSize
member.summary: Stores the initial parent size when anchor offsets were calculated. Serialized so anchor adjustments work correctly after layout reload.

member.name: M:FishUI.Controls.Control.UpdateChildAnchorOffsets(FishUI.Controls.Control)
member.summary: Updates the anchor offset values for a child control based on current parent size.

member.name: M:FishUI.Controls.Control.RecalculateChildAnchors
member.summary: Recalculates anchor offsets for all children. Call after parent is resized.

member.name: M:FishUI.Controls.Control.UpdateOwnAnchorOffsets
member.summary: Updates this control's anchor offsets based on its current position and parent size. Call after manually changing a control's position (e.g., in an editor) to keep anchoring in sync.

member.name: M:FishUI.Controls.Control.GetAnchorAdjustedRelativePosition
member.summary: Gets this control's position with anchor adjustments applied. Returns the relative position (to parent) adjusted for anchor settings based on parent size changes.
member.returns: The anchor-adjusted relative position.

member.name: M:FishUI.Controls.Control.GetAnchorAdjustedSize
member.summary: Gets this control's size with anchor stretching applied. Returns the size adjusted for anchor settings when anchored to opposite edges (stretch behavior).
member.returns: The anchor-adjusted size.

member.name: M:FishUI.Controls.Control.DrawAnchorVisualization(FishUI.FishUI)
member.summary: Draws yellow lines to visualize anchor connections to parent control.

member.name: T:FishUI.IFishUIForm
member.summary: Base interface for FishUI designer-generated form classes. Implement this interface to create forms that can be loaded from .Designer.cs files generated by the FishUI Layout Editor.

remarks.para:
Forms are typically split into two partial class files:
MyForm.Designer.cs - Auto-generated control creation code
MyForm.cs - User code with event handlers and custom logic

member.name: M:FishUI.IFishUIForm.Init(FishUI.FishUISettings,FishUI.IFishUIGfx,FishUI.IFishUIInput,FishUI.IFishUIEvents)
member.summary: Initializes the FishUI instance with the provided settings and backends.
member.remarks: Override this method to customize FishUI initialization, such as loading a custom theme or configuring UI scale. The default generated implementation is empty, leaving initialization to the calling code.
member.param: UI settings including theme and scale.

member.name: M:FishUI.IFishUIForm.LoadControls(FishUI.FishUI)
member.summary: Creates all controls defined in the form and adds them to the FishUI instance.
member.remarks: This method is auto-generated by the FishUI Layout Editor's "Export as C#" feature. It creates control instances, sets their properties, establishes parent-child relationships, and adds root controls to the FishUI instance.
member.param: The FishUI instance to add controls to.

member.name: M:FishUI.IFishUIForm.OnLoaded
member.summary: Called after all controls have been loaded and added to the form.
member.remarks:
Override this method in your user code partial class to:
Wire up event handlers (OnButtonPressed, OnValueChanged, etc.)
Initialize control data (populate listboxes, set initial values)
Perform any post-load setup that requires controls to exist

member.name: T:FishUI.SimpleFishUIGfx
member.summary: Simplified abstract base class for graphics backends. Provides default implementations for many methods by composing them from primitive operations.
member.remarks:
Override only what you need. Minimum required overrides for a functional backend: - Init(), GetWindowWidth(), GetWindowHeight() - LoadImage(string), LoadFont(string, float, float, FishColor) - DrawLine(), DrawRectangle(), DrawImage() (basic overload) - DrawTextColorScale(), MeasureText() - BeginScissor(), EndScissor()
Optional overrides for better performance: - DrawRectangleOutline() - defaults to 4 DrawLine calls - DrawCircle(), DrawCircleOutline() - defaults to polygon approximation - DrawNPatch() - defaults to 9 DrawImageRegion calls - PushScissor(), PopScissor() - defaults to stack-based BeginScissor/EndScissor

member.name: M:FishUI.SimpleFishUIGfx.Init
member.summary: Initializes the graphics backend.

member.name: M:FishUI.SimpleFishUIGfx.GetWindowWidth
member.summary: Gets the window width in pixels.

member.name: M:FishUI.SimpleFishUIGfx.GetWindowHeight
member.summary: Gets the window height in pixels.

member.name: M:FishUI.SimpleFishUIGfx.FocusWindow
member.summary: Sets the input focus to the current window, bringing it to the foreground and making it the active window for user interaction.
member.remarks: This method is typically used in user interface applications to ensure that the window is ready to receive user input. If the window is already focused, calling this method may have no effect. The exact behavior may vary depending on the operating system and window manager.

member.name: M:FishUI.SimpleFishUIGfx.DrawImageRegion(FishUI.ImageRef,System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Numerics.Vector2,FishUI.FishColor)
